title: eth/downloader: index allocation went beyond available resultCache space
body:
I have just downloaded the latest geth client and started to sync with the testnet. I got a hard to reproduce bug see below. Hope it helps. I'm running 64 bit Windows 10 Pro:

```
I0226 13:35:40.549677   68828 blockchain.go:1243] imported 256 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 9 txs in 1.4245174s. #198359 [4744047b / a0011a2b]

You've encountered a sought after, hard to reproduce bug. Please report this to the developers <3 https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues
index allocation went beyond available resultCache space

c:/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1696 (0x49b271)
#### BUG! PLEASE REPORT ####
I0226 13:35:44.354259   68828 blockchain.go:1243] imported 256 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 4 txs in 842.0071ms. #199383 [cb721a8e / f2f7c38e]
I0226 13:35:45.185260   68828 blockchain.go:1243] imported 256 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 6 txs in 824.5013ms. #199639 [2b38f1fe / 13864f5f]

```
Thanks for the report. @fjl you've added this one. Can you remember? https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blame/develop/eth/downloader/queue.go#L586

Sorry, I only got to it now. I added the call to `common.Report` together with @karalabe because this should usually not happen, but we didn't want to use `panic`. The scheduling logic is non-trivial and I'm can't think of a situation in which it could possibly happen.

Yeah, I was pondering about this. But we've managed to encounter it for the first time in months after being added so it's on a very weird code path. I don't think we'll be able to debug it unless we can cat a full downloader log dump that lead to this.

Dunno if this will help.  Judging by how you guys say something about needing a full downloader log dump, I'm going to guess this won't help.

Closing as it's an ancient bug and most of the downloader was rewritten since.
